00030 #ifdef STAT_MACROS_BROKEN

00043 #ifndef S_IFMT
00044 #define S_IFMT 0170000
00045 #endif
00046 #if !defined(S_ISBLK) && defined(S_IFBLK)
00047 #define S_ISBLK(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFBLK)
00048 #endif
00049 #if !defined(S_ISCHR) && defined(S_IFCHR)
00050 #define S_ISCHR(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFCHR)
00051 #endif
00052 #if !defined(S_ISDIR) && defined(S_IFDIR)
00053 #define S_ISDIR(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFDIR)
00054 #endif
00055 #if !defined(S_ISREG) && defined(S_IFREG)
00056 #define S_ISREG(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFREG)
00057 #endif
00058 #if !defined(S_ISFIFO) && defined(S_IFIFO)
00059 #define S_ISFIFO(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFIFO)
00060 #endif
00061 #if !defined(S_ISLNK) && defined(S_IFLNK)
00062 #define S_ISLNK(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFLNK)
00063 #endif
00064 #if !defined(S_ISSOCK) && defined(S_IFSOCK)
00065 #define S_ISSOCK(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFSOCK)
00066 #endif
00067 #if !defined(S_ISMPB) && defined(S_IFMPB) /* V7 */
00068 #define S_ISMPB(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFMPB)
00069 #define S_ISMPC(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFMPC)
00070 #endif
00071 #if !defined(S_ISNWK) && defined(S_IFNWK) /* HP/UX */
00072 #define S_ISNWK(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFNWK)
00073 #endif

00075 #ifndef S_IEXEC
00076 #define S_IEXEC S_IXUSR
00077 #endif
00078 
00079 #ifndef S_IXUSR
00080 #define S_IXUSR S_IEXEC
00081 #endif
00082 #ifndef S_IXGRP
00083 #define S_IXGRP (S_IEXEC >> 3)
00084 #endif
00085 #ifndef S_IXOTH
00086 #define S_IXOTH (S_IEXEC >> 6)
00087 #endif
00088 #ifndef S_IXUGO
00089 #define S_IXUGO (S_IXUSR | S_IXGRP | S_IXOTH)
00090 #endif

00129 /* Since major is a function on SVR4, we can't use `ifndef major'.  */
00130 #ifdef MAJOR_IN_MKDEV
00131 #include <sys/mkdev.h>
00132 #define HAVE_MAJOR
00133 #endif
00134 #ifdef MAJOR_IN_SYSMACROS
00135 #include <sys/sysmacros.h>
00136 #define HAVE_MAJOR
00137 #endif
00138 #ifdef major                    /* Might be defined in sys/types.h.  */
00139 #define HAVE_MAJOR
00140 #endif
00141 
00142 #ifndef HAVE_MAJOR
00143 #define major(dev)  (((dev) >> 8) & 0xff)
00144 #define minor(dev)  ((dev) & 0xff)
00145 #define makedev(maj, min)  (((maj) << 8) | (min))
00146 #endif
00147 #undef HAVE_MAJOR

00243 /* Get or fake the disk device blocksize.
00244    Usually defined by sys/param.h (if at all).  */
00245 #ifndef DEV_BSIZE
00246 #ifdef BSIZE
00247 #define DEV_BSIZE BSIZE
00248 #else /* !BSIZE */
00249 #define DEV_BSIZE 4096
00250 #endif /* !BSIZE */
00251 #endif /* !DEV_BSIZE */
00252 
00253 /* Extract or fake data from a `struct stat'.
00254    ST_BLKSIZE: Optimal I/O blocksize for the file, in bytes.
00255    ST_NBLOCKS: Number of 512-byte blocks in the file
00256    (including indirect blocks). */
00257 #ifndef HAVE_ST_BLOCKS
00258 # define ST_BLKSIZE(statbuf) DEV_BSIZE
00259 # if defined(_POSIX_SOURCE) || !defined(BSIZE) /* fileblocks.c uses BSIZE.  */
00260 #  define ST_NBLOCKS(statbuf) (((statbuf).st_size + 512 - 1) / 512)
00261 # else /* !_POSIX_SOURCE && BSIZE */
00262 #  define ST_NBLOCKS(statbuf) (st_blocks ((statbuf).st_size))
00263 # endif /* !_POSIX_SOURCE && BSIZE */
00264 #else /* HAVE_ST_BLOCKS */
00265 /* Some systems, like Sequents, return st_blksize of 0 on pipes. */
00266 # define ST_BLKSIZE(statbuf) ((statbuf).st_blksize > 0 \
00267                                ? (statbuf).st_blksize : DEV_BSIZE)
00268 # if defined(hpux) || defined(__hpux__) || defined(__hpux)
00269 /* HP-UX counts st_blocks in 1024-byte units.
00270    This loses when mixing HP-UX and BSD filesystems with NFS.  */
00271 #  define ST_NBLOCKS(statbuf) ((statbuf).st_blocks * 2)
00272 # else /* !hpux */
00273 #  if defined(_AIX) && defined(_I386)
00274 /* AIX PS/2 counts st_blocks in 4K units.  */
00275 #   define ST_NBLOCKS(statbuf) ((statbuf).st_blocks * 8)
00276 #  else /* not AIX PS/2 */
00277 #   if defined(_CRAY)
00278 #    define ST_NBLOCKS(statbuf) ((statbuf).st_blocks * ST_BLKSIZE(statbuf)/512)
00279 #   else /* not AIX PS/2 nor CRAY */
00280 #    define ST_NBLOCKS(statbuf) ((statbuf).st_blocks)
00281 #   endif /* not _CRAY */
00282 #  endif /* not AIX PS/2 */
00283 # endif /* !hpux */
00284 #endif /* HAVE_ST_BLOCKS */
00285 
00286 /* Convert B 512-byte blocks to kilobytes if K is nonzero,
00287    otherwise return it unchanged. */
00288 #define convert_blocks(b, k) ((k) ? ((b) + 1) / 2 : (b))

00292 #endif

00295 # undef alloca
00296 # define alloca __builtin_alloca
00297 #else
00298 # ifdef HAVE_ALLOCA_H
00299 #  include <alloca.h>
00300 # else
00301 #  ifndef _AIX
00302 /* AIX alloca decl has to be the first thing in the file, bletch! */
00303 char *alloca ();
00304 #  endif
00305 # endif
00306 #endif
00307 
00308 #include <ctype.h>
00309 
00310 /* Jim Meyering writes:
00311 
00312    "... Some ctype macros are valid only for character codes that
00313    isascii says are ASCII (SGI's IRIX-4.0.5 is one such system --when
00314    using /bin/cc or gcc but without giving an ansi option).  So, all
00315    ctype uses should be through macros like ISPRINT...  If
00316    STDC_HEADERS is defined, then autoconf has verified that the ctype
00317    macros don't need to be guarded with references to isascii. ...
00318    Defining isascii to 1 should let any compiler worth its salt
00319    eliminate the && through constant folding."
00320 
00321    Bruno Haible adds:
00322 
00323    "... Furthermore, isupper(c) etc. have an undefined result if c is
00324    outside the range -1 <= c <= 255. One is tempted to write isupper(c)
00325    with c being of type `char', but this is wrong if c is an 8-bit
00326    character >= 128 which gets sign-extended to a negative value.
00327    The macro ISUPPER protects against this as well."  */
00328 
00329 #if defined (STDC_HEADERS) || (!defined (isascii) && !defined (HAVE_ISASCII))
00330 #define IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN(c) 1
00331 #else
00332 #define IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN(c) isascii(c)
00333 #endif
00334 
00335 #ifdef isblank
00336 #define ISBLANK(c) (IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN (c) && isblank (c))
00337 #else
00338 #define ISBLANK(c) ((c) == ' ' || (c) == '\t')
00339 #endif
00340 #ifdef isgraph
00341 #define ISGRAPH(c) (IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN (c) && isgraph (c))
00342 #else
00343 #define ISGRAPH(c) (IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN (c) && isprint (c) && !isspace (c))
00344 #endif
00345 
00346 #define ISPRINT(c) (IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN (c) && isprint (c))
00347 #define ISALNUM(c) (IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN (c) && isalnum (c))
00348 #define ISALPHA(c) (IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN (c) && isalpha (c))
00349 #define ISCNTRL(c) (IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN (c) && iscntrl (c))
00350 #define ISLOWER(c) (IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN (c) && islower (c))
00351 #define ISPUNCT(c) (IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN (c) && ispunct (c))
00352 #define ISSPACE(c) (IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN (c) && isspace (c))
00353 #define ISUPPER(c) (IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN (c) && isupper (c))
00354 #define ISXDIGIT(c) (IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN (c) && isxdigit (c))
00355 #define ISDIGIT_LOCALE(c) (IN_CTYPE_DOMAIN (c) && isdigit (c))
00356 
00357 /* ISDIGIT differs from ISDIGIT_LOCALE, as follows:
00358    - Its arg may be any int or unsigned int; it need not be an unsigned char.
00359    - It's guaranteed to evaluate its argument exactly once.
00360    - It's typically faster.
00361    Posix 1003.2-1992 section 2.5.2.1 page 50 lines 1556-1558 says that
00362    only '0' through '9' are digits.  Prefer ISDIGIT to ISDIGIT_LOCALE unless
00363    it's important to use the locale's definition of `digit' even when the
00364    host does not conform to Posix.  */
00365 #define ISDIGIT(c) ((unsigned) (c) - '0' <= 9)
00366 
00367 #ifndef __P
00368 #if defined (__GNUC__) || (defined (__STDC__) && __STDC__)
00369 #define __P(args) args
00370 #else
00371 #define __P(args) ()
00372 #endif  /* GCC.  */
00373 #endif  /* Not __P.  */
00374

00379 #endif

00381 # define setlocale(Category, Locale) /* empty */
00382 #endif

00384 #if ENABLE_NLS
00385 # include <libintl.h>
00386 # define _(Text) gettext (Text)
00387 #else
00388 # undef bindtextdomain
00389 # define bindtextdomain(Domain, Directory) /* empty */
00390 # undef textdomain
00391 # define textdomain(Domain) /* empty */
00392 # define _(Text) Text

00395 #define STREQ(a,b) (strcmp((a), (b)) == 0)
